intro: Anoda crenatiflora, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with palmate leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Anoda crenatiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
